title: How many US small businesses have loans? - Quora

response.answer_text: While you typically won’t be able to find information regarding loans provided by private institutions to companies, the U.S. Small Business Administration does provide full transparency about their loans, following the Freedom of Information Act. You can find the specifics regarding the number of businesses and how much they took out in loans in the FY 2015 Agency Financial Report (AFR). For example, here’s what you’ll learn from the 2015 financial report: In FY 2015, the SBA supported nearly $33 billion in lending through our 7(a) and 504 loan programs. These loans supported over 680,000 jobs across the country. Hope this helps your search. -Jared

Not all business loans /lending is reported and tracked unless it’s over $1 million, according to the SBA. The SBA offers a plethora of information and statistics on the matter: Small Business Lending in the United States, 2016
